skill.summary: A conceptual skill for implementing CRUD features driven by Spec-Kit and Claude Code

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Static findings are false positives from the scanner misinterpreting documentation text as security patterns. The skill-report.json internal audit explicitly confirms this is safe documentation with no scripts, network calls, or filesystem access.

content.user_title: Generate CRUD APIs from Spec-Kit specs
content.value_statement: Building CRUD APIs from scratch wastes time and introduces inconsistencies. This skill leverages Spec-Kit specifications to automatically generate backend routes, frontend clients, and validation code. AI-assisted development ensures implementation matches specifications exactly.
actual_capabilities: Parse Spec-Kit specification files to extract entity definitions
Generate RESTful API endpoints with proper HTTP methods
Create frontend API client code and data models
Validate implementation against specification success criteria
Generate test cases from specification requirements
limitations: Not suitable for complex business logic beyond basic CRUD
Cannot handle non-standard data access patterns

use_cases.title: Rapid API scaffolding
use_cases.description: Generate complete REST API endpoints for new data entities from specification files in minutes instead of hours.

use_cases.title: Frontend-backend consistency
use_cases.description: Create matching frontend clients and data models that exactly match backend API contracts defined in specifications.

use_cases.title: Specification enforcement
use_cases.description: Validate that development work meets specification requirements before merging to ensure consistency across the codebase.

prompt_templates.title: Basic CRUD generation
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate CRUD for a simple entity
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the CRUD with Spec-Kit skill to generate REST API routes for a User entity with id, name, email, and created_at fields from the provided spec file.

prompt_templates.title: Full-stack generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate complete CRUD functionality for a Product entity including backend Express routes, TypeScript client, and React components based on the Spec-Kit specification.

prompt_templates.title: Validation enforcement
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate the current implementation against the Product.spec.md specification and report any gaps in required CRUD operations.

prompt_templates.title: Test generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate integration tests for all CRUD endpoints defined in the Order.spec.md specification using the testing patterns from the Spec-Kit framework.

output_examples.input: Generate REST API routes for a BlogPost entity with title, content, author, published_at, and status fields
output: GET /api/posts/:id - Get single post by ID
POST /api/posts - Create new blog post with validation

output_examples.input: Create a frontend client for a Product API with CRUD operations
output: ProductService class with getAll, getById, create, update, delete methods
TypeScript interfaces for Product data model
React hooks for each CRUD operation

best_practices: Start with complete Spec-Kit specifications before triggering code generation
Review generated validation rules to ensure they match business requirements
Run specification compliance checks after implementing each CRUD endpoint
anti_patterns: Generating CRUD code without first validating specification completeness
Ignoring specification constraints when customizing generated code
Using the skill for complex business logic that should be separate from data access

faq.question: What Spec-Kit file formats are supported?
faq.answer: Standard Spec-Kit YAML and JSON specification files with entity definitions, attributes, relationships, and success criteria.

faq.question: What programming languages can this generate?
faq.answer: Language output depends on your specification and target framework. Works with JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Go, and other languages.

faq.question: Can I customize generated code?
faq.answer: Yes. Generated code serves as a starting point. You can modify any output to fit your project conventions and requirements.

faq.question: Does this skill access my filesystem?
faq.answer: This is a conceptual skill. Actual file access depends on how Claude Code implements the specification-driven development workflow.

faq.question: How does this compare to ORMs like Prisma?
faq.answer: This skill generates code from specifications, not schema definitions. It covers full-stack concerns including API routes and frontend clients.

faq.question: Can I use this without Spec-Kit?
faq.answer: No. This skill requires Spec-Kit specification files as input to drive the code generation process.
